title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: Welcome atctools package vignette! vignette provides overview package functionality, demonstrates usage key functions, explains example datasets included.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: atctools package provides tools ATC (Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical) code matching data integrity checks drug names. includes functions matching drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_match function matches drug names dataset corresponding ATC codes using reference dataset. strip trailing characters drug names. Usage:
code: library(atctools)  # Load example datasets data(example_drug_data) data(example_reference_data)  # Perform drug matching output_data <- drug_match(example_drug_data, "drug_name", example_reference_data)

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_match_strip function matches drug names dataset corresponding ATC codes, stripping trailing characters (e.g., “mg”, “g”) drug names matching. Usage:
code: # Load example dataset with drug names including milligrams data(example_drug_data_with_mg)  # Perform drug matching with trailing characters stripped output_data <- drug_match_strip(example_drug_data_with_mg, "drug_name", example_reference_data)

text: dataset contains example drug names without milligrams.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset contains example drug names including milligrams.

text: dataset reference dataset containing example ATC codes corresponding drug names drug matching.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_name_flag column output dataset indicates whether prefix mismatch drug name matched ATC code. 1: Indicates mismatch first three characters drug name match first three characters ATC code. 0: Indicates match first three characters drug name match first three characters ATC code.

what: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: atctools R package designed facilitating Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) matching ensuring integrity ATC data pharmaceutical datasets.

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: ATC Matching: Functions match drug names ATC codes using methods Levenshtein distance. ATC Data Integrity Checks: Tools verify consistency correctness ATC data.

what: Example usage of ATC matching function
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: drug_match function atctools useful matching drug names ATC codes.
code: # Load the package library(atctools)  # Example data with drug names input_data <- data.frame(drug_name = c("Aspirin", "Paracetamol", "Ibuprofen"))  # Reference data containing ATC codes and corresponding drug names reference_data <- list(ATC_codes = c("N02BA01", "N02BE01", "N02AA02"),   # Perform drug matching drug_names = c("aspirin", "paracetamol", "ibuprofen"))  # View the processed output output_data <- drug_match(input_data, "drug_name", reference_data)

what: Example usage of ATC matching function with trailing milligrams stripping
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: drug_match_strip function atctools useful matching drug names ATC codes stripping specific trailing characters, “milligrams”. can particularly helpful dealing pharmaceutical data drug names may include dosage information needs normalized.
code: # Load the package library(atctools)  # Example data with drug names including dosage information input_data <- data.frame(drug_name = c("Aspirin 100mg", "Paracetamol 500mg", "Ibuprofen 200mg"))  # Reference data containing ATC codes and corresponding drug names reference_data <- list(ATC_codes = c("N02BA01", "N02BE01", "N02AA02"), drug_names = c("aspirin", "paracetamol", "ibuprofen"))  # Perform drug matching with trailing milligrams stripping output_data_stripped <- drug_match_strip(input_data, "drug_name", reference_data)  # View the processed output output_data_stripped

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: output data frame produced drug_match drug_match_strip functions, drug_name_flag column indicates whether discrepancy stripped drug name used matching closest matching drug name reference data. Specifically: Purpose: drug_name_flag column flags instances first three characters stripped drug name match corresponding ATC code’s initial characters. helps identify potential mismatches inconsistencies drug naming conventions. Flag Values: 1: Indicates mismatch first three characters stripped drug name differ corresponding ATC code. 0: Indicates mismatch; first three characters stripped drug name match corresponding ATC code.
